sentences: Ma ei ole iialgi olnud selles linnas.
Kas sa oled kunagi külastanud seda muuseumi?
Ta on alati öelnud, et ta ei tee seda iialgi.
context: The Estonian word 'iialgi' is an adverb that means 'never' or 'not ever'. It's used to express that something has not happened at any time in the past and will not happen in the future. This word combines 'iial' (ever) with '-gi' (also/either), but functions as a single negative temporal adverb in Estonian.
